value.0: <StartAction>[Nelgir offers you a sly smile.]</Start> I cannot begin to thank you for helping me get rid of that awful spirit, <lad/lass>...
<StartAction>[The merchant removes a hefty pouch of gold, handing it over to you reluctantly.]</Start> As promised, here is your reward... I suppose it was well spent to rid me of that awful being...

And all out of the goodness of your heart... <StartAction>[Nelgir snickers at your foolishness for not requesting a reward.]</Start> Now, you've done your service to me... I must ask that you leave and let me continue my business...
Thank you once more for your assistance... but it would likely be better if we do not see each other again... Wouldn't want anyone getting any ideas, now would we?
<StartAction>[As if to reinforce his point, Nelgir turns away from you, pointedly avoiding any further conversation.]</Start>

<StartAction>[Nelgir snarls angrily at you.]</Start> I hope you burn in the hells for this, <lad/lass>! I... I had it all planned out, and you had to come along and ruin it all! A curse on all the line of <LastName>!

<StartAction>[Nelgir turns to you as you greet him, but you notice he continues glancing nervously at the nearby spirit from the corner of his eye.]</Start> Have... have you discovered a way to disperse this ghastly spirit, <lad/lass>?
<StartAction>[The Elven merchant snarls at you viciously.]</Start> Then begone from my stand! I have more than enough to worry about without you tarrying around here all <quarterday>!
Please hurry! Every hour that passes with that ghastly thing hovering around here drives away more and more of my business! I can ill afford for this to continue much longer...
<StartAction>[Nelgir's expression becomes one of mixed fear and anger.]</Start> And... and just what do you intend to do with that... that body, <lad/lass>?
<StartAction>[Nelgir seems quite displeased by this turn of events, but he nods his head.]</Start> I suppose you do have me in a rather precarious situation, <lad/lass>...
<StartAction>[Nelgir's eyes grow even more frightened.]</Start> Please! You must not do that! It... it will be the end of me!
I'll tell you what. I'll give you 300 gold pieces if you'll turn that body over to me, and never speak of this again!
<StartAction>[The Elven merchant hands over a large pouch of gold, and you in turn give him the body of his dead father.]</Start>

<StartAction>[The spirit of Nelgir's father begins to thrash about, its moans growing louder and louder. Ghostly tears leave a puddle about its feet. Slowly, painfully, the old man's form begins to fade.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Nelgir snickers at what remains of the fading spirit.]</Start> You won't stop me, you dead, doddering fool! Even now, I outsmart you at every turn!
No... I've spent far more than I could afford on this situation as it is. You either can take the 300 gold, or leave it, but you'll not see another coin more from me!
<StartAction>[Nelgir snarls at you.]</Start> Then run on to Ganolin, but I'll deny every bit of it! You... You'll see! No one will believe your silly story!

<StartAction>[Nelgir's eyes grow large in surprise, but he quickly tries to hide it.]</Start> I... I have no idea what you are talking about, <man/woman>! What... what lies has that Elven witch told you?!
<StartAction>[Nelgir looks at you suspiciously.]</Start> Well, assuming that your guess is right... which I'm not saying it is... what is it you propose to do about it?
<StartAction>[Nelgir groans, but nods his head in resignation.]</Start> Very well, <lad/lass>... Find a way to rid me of the spirit, and I shall double your reward...
Now, I've had all I can take of you for the time being! Away, now, and leave me to my gems!
<StartAction>[Nelgir narrows his eyes towards you, hatred brimming beneath their gaze.]</Start> Even if such were the truth, you have no evidence, <lad/lass>! You can prove nothing!
<StartAction>[Nelgir looks at you long and hard before speaking.]</Start> If you can find a way to rid me of this spirit, I will double the reward I have promised you...
Good... Now, begone from my sight, and do not return until you have sent that spirit back to the Underworld where it belongs!
<StartAction>[Nelgir cocks his head back arrogantly, but you see fear in his eyes.]</Start> You do that, <lad/lass>! See where it gets you! I'll not be swayed by your threats!
I have already agreed to double your reward if you can find a way to rid me of his damned ghost! Now, do not trouble me further until you have done so!
<StartAction>[Nelgir turns in your direction, his face ashen white.]</Start> You there, you saw what... what that thief of a woman did, didn't you?
<StartAction>[Nelgir looks at you pleadingly.]</Start> I know you must have seen her summon this... this thing! You have to help me!
Please! I will pay you if you will aid me! I... I was simply trying to make a bit of extra gold from that woman, not... not bring all of this about!

That woman... she will ruin me! The... the gem is of little importance, but... but no one will come to my merchant stand with this... this... this... thing hanging about! <StartAction>[Nelgir motions towards the spirit standing nearby.]</Start>
<StartAction>[At Nelgir's words, the spirit seems to grow angry, thrashing its arms about widely and moaning strangely.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Nelgir jumps back, his expression terrified.]</Start> Please! Please, you must help me get rid of this beastly spirit!
Please! I must find a way to get rid of this spirit! It will ruin my business! I'll... I'll pay you 200 gold pieces if you will aid me! Just... just find a way to send it back from wherever it came!
Oh... oh, thank you, <sir/madam>! You are most gracious to aid me so!

I'd be more than willing to pay you 200 gold pieces if you can find a way to rid me of this cursed spirit. If this thing continues to haunt my stand for much longer, it will drive me out of business, so it is a small price to pay...

<StartAction>[The merchant seems quite distraught over your refusal to aid him, but nods his head reluctantly.]</Start> Very well, then. But my offer shall stand if you should happen to change your mind...

<StartAction>[Success]</Start> And the people of this district claim I am a crook! <StartAction>[Grumble.]</Start> You drive a hard bargain, my young friend, but so be it. I shall pay you 400 gold if you can rid me of this thing!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I believe I have offered you more than enough for your aid, <lad/lass>... You can either take it or leave it...
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> Hmmm... Your offer has merit, <lad/lass>, and I suppose I could part with a few more gold to be rid of this spirit. You have yourself a deal...
You... you are truly a great <man/woman>, to help a poor merchant such as myself so nobly! You shall have my eternal gratitude if you can help me in this matter.

That woman couldn't have gotten far yet, and she seemed like a stranger to Ghaarak to me... Perhaps she's staying at the Ravenclaw Tavern... Please, please, see if you can get her to banish this awful spirit!

<StartAction>[Nelgir's expression turns to one of shock as he looks upon a ghastly, mutilated spirit which has risen from the ground. His grip on the woman's arm weakens as he stares in wide-eyed wonder...]</Start>
I believe this is my cue to leave... <StartAction>[Taking her stolen gem, the Elven woman quickly makes her escape...]</Start>
Hey! Wait a minute! You... you come back! <StartAction>[The gem trader's pleas go unanswered as the Elven woman quickly makes her escape...]</Start>

<StartAction>[As you approach the Elven gem trader, Nelgir, he pays you little heed... His attention is diverted for the moment to the dark haired Elven woman standing across the counter from him.]</Start>
Come now, Nelgir, there is no way that Bloodstone could possibly be worth more than a couple of gold pieces. You wouldn't rob a lady in such a fashion, would you?
<StartAction>[Nelgir snickers.]</Start> Take your charms elsewhere, woman! I'll have none of it! If you want the bloody stone so bad, you'll pay what I ask for!
<StartAction>[The Elven woman leans in nearer to Nelgir, stroking the side of his face softly.]</Start> Now, now, that's no way to speak to a lady... Maybe we can work out another... arrangement...
<StartAction>[Nelgir arches his eyebrow high.]</Start> That depends on what you had in mind...
<StartAction>[Suddenly, your attention is drawn to the fact that the Elven woman is deftly pocketing the gem in question as she attempts to seduce Nelgir, right under his very nose...]</Start>

<StartAction>[As the woman places the jewel in her belt pouch, she quickly steps back from Nelgir, abruptly ending her charade.]</Start> Actually, come to think of it, I don't think I need the gem so badly...
<StartAction>[As you debate whether to speak up or not, Nelgir suddenly realizes the Elven woman's ruse.]</Start> Wait a minute... You... you thief! Give me back my Bloodstone!

<StartAction>[The Elven woman makes to run, but Nelgir grabs her forearm roughly, holding her in place.]</Start> You'll not be going anywhere with my goods, wench! You'll stay here like a good girl, and wait for the guards to arrive!
<StartAction>[The woman curses softly, then turns a steely gaze towards Nelgir.]</Start> You'll come to regret this, worm!
<StartAction>[The woman begins uttering a dark incantation.]</Start> Akhana, Mistress of Death, hear my plea! Send me a servant to break this cur's hold on me!
<StartAction>[The ground begins to shake around the merchant stand, and Nelgir's eyes grow wide...]</Start> Wh... what in the hells?
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_KARA" >>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 0. >>
<< This conversation node does nothing but reset the variable "N_TALK_SWITCH" >>
<< This node sets up custom string "9999" to be the name of the conversation owner >>
I have no time for such nonsense, merchant!
I'm working on it, Nelgir. Just give me a bit more time.
I found this body in the sewers... Your dagger's in its back...
How much is it worth to you?
I believe Officer Ganolin will take an interest in it...
Hand over 300 gold, and the body's yours...
Make it 500 gold, and you have yourself a deal.
You won't buy your way out of this one, Nelgir...
Very well... 300 gold and the body's yours.
We'll see about that, murderer...
We need to speak about your father, Nelgir...
Don't worry, your secret's safe with me...
I will find a way to bring you to justice, murderer...
Double the reward and I can still rid you of his ghost.
You had your father killed, didn't you...
I am open to... suggestions, Nelgir...
That sounds fair enough...
I will find a way to bring you to justice, murderer...
I have no idea what you're talking about...
Well, perhaps I did, and perhaps I didn't...
Yes, I saw her take your gem...
I have other affairs to attend to at the moment...
I might be willing to help you... for a price...
Alright... You do seem a bit down on your luck.
I don't want to get involved with this right now...
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> I'll help you for 400 gold pieces...
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> Make it 300 and we have a deal.
I'll help you, but there's no need for a reward...
200 gold pieces sounds fair.
Very well. I'll return once I have more information.
